name: Sphygmomanometer
specification: Available as manual or electronic; includes an inflatable cuff, pressure gauge or digital display; designed to measure blood pressure in mmHg.
function: Used to measure systolic and diastolic blood pressure by occluding and then releasing blood flow in the brachial artery.
usage: Wrap the cuff snugly around the upper arm at heart level; inflate cuff above expected systolic pressure; gradually release air while listening or observing gauge; record systolic and diastolic readings.
maintenance: Keep cuff clean and dry; regularly calibrate device to ensure accuracy; check for leaks or damaged parts and replace as necessary.
warning: Using a cuff that is too small or incorrectly placed can result in inaccurate readings; follow proper technique to ensure reliable measurements.
